title: How involved do people feel in discussing their care?
analysis_commentary: Evidence from academic research suggests that when people are involved in their own care, decisions are made more effectively and health outcomes improve. In 2015, 92% of people felt that decisions had been made together with the NHS mental health services worker in the formal meeting to discuss how their care is working. This was an increase from 91% in 2014. 93% felt they were involved as much as they wanted to be in discussing how their care was working (data not shown).
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
